pull.title: Build broken without miniupnpc
pull.body:
Hi,

My build broke saying:

```
net.cpp:8: fatal error: miniupnpc/miniwget.h: No such file or directory
```

So I fixed it and made a patch. The patch was made and tested against `v0.3.21` on a GNU/Linux, but it should be good to apply on `master` as well. Also, it was not tested with USE_UPNP=1, but I don't see why it should fail.

Yours,
Amir

events.body: I'm getting kind of tired of explaining this.  USE_UPNP=1 means UPnP is on by default.  USE_UPNP=0 means UPnP is compiled in and off by default.  If you undefine USE_UPNP by building with USE_UPNP=  UPnP is not compiled in any the errors go away.  Please do a bit of searching before submitting bug/pull requests.

events.message: Clarify the meaning of USE_UPNP in build-unix.txt

events.body: OK, thanks for the clarification! Now if you pull my revised patch, people will get this clarification in `build-unix.txt`.
Now that is a great idea.  (and here I was thinking that was already in there) sorry for going off on you.
Your earlier comment was constructive nonetheless â€“ no offense taken. :)
